definitions.body: dwell (orig. move in a circle, go about, surround, cf. Ar. da0ra; da0run house, esp. as group of buildings about a court; As. dûru, wall, fortress, COT:Gloss; thence (denom. Fl NH WB:i. 440) dwell Aram. [[דּוּר]], dor (pt. & Pa), hence in Heb. cf. Giesebr:ZAW i. 304 Fl:l.c. Che:OP 479; Eth. d4r: generation (= [[דּוֹר]]: prob. loan-word); acc. to Hpt KAT:2 Gloss. i. As. [daru§, endure], dârû, everlasting (cf. Bez:Orient. Diplom.) = Ar. dahrun long time, age)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: in Inf. [[מִדּוּר באהלי־רשׁע]] Ps 84:11 than to dwell in tents of wickedness. Imv. (or Inf. abs. irreg. for [[דּוֹר]], cf. ‖[[לָקוֹחַ]]) [[דּוּר העחמים]] Ez Eze 24:5 heap up.—In Ge 6:3 some rd. Impf. 3 ms. [[יׇדוּר]] shall dwell, for [[ידון]]; v. [[דין]].
